private_information: Expertise in extracting action schemas and predicate semantics from natural descriptions
Familiar with STRIPS-style operators and add/delete effects
rules_miner.goal: Derive a clean, unambiguous set of predicates and action schemas (parameters, preconditions, add effects, delete effects) from the public descriptions.

private_information: Expertise in normalizing object sets, aggregating initial facts, and structuring multi-scenario goals
Skilled at validating that preconditions are consistent with available facts
state_analyst.goal: Aggregate all object symbols, normalize and partition the initial conditions and goals into scenarios, and ensure they align with the extracted action schemas.

private_information: Expertise in authoring PDDL domains and problems compatible with the FastDownward solver
Capable of integrating partial specifications from multiple contributors into a coherent planning model
orchestrator.goal: Produce a correct PDDL domain and two PDDL problem instances (scenario_a and scenario_b) targeting the FastDownward solver, based on the extracted action schemas and the scenario states.

public_information: Use-case: I am playing with a set of objects and can perform six actions: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted.
Predicates (untyped): hand(x), cats(x), sneeze(x), spring(x), stupendous(x), texture(x), collect(x,y), next(x,y), vase(x,y).
Action schema paltry(x,y,z): Preconditions: hand(x), cats(y), texture(z), vase(x,y), next(y,z). Effects add: next(x,z). Effects del: vase(x,y).
Action schema sip(x,y,z): Preconditions: hand(x), cats(y), texture(z), next(x,z), next(y,z). Effects add: vase(x,y). Effects del: next(x,z).
Action schema clip(x,y,z): Preconditions: hand(x), sneeze(y), texture(z), next(y,z), next(x,z). Effects add: vase(x,y). Effects del: next(x,z).
Action schema wretched(w,x,y,z): Preconditions: sneeze(w), texture(x), texture(y), stupendous(z), next(w,x), collect(x,z), collect(y,z). Effects add: next(w,y). Effects del: next(w,x).
Action schema memory(x,y,z): Preconditions: cats(x), spring(y), spring(z), next(x,y). Effects add: next(x,z). Effects del: next(x,y).
Action schema tightfisted(x,y,z): Preconditions: hand(x), sneeze(y), texture(z), next(y,z), vase(x,y). Effects add: next(x,z). Effects del: vase(x,y).
Scenario A objects: object_0 to object_12 inclusive are potentially relevant; scenario content may reference further objects as needed by the union set.

Scenario A initial facts: cats object_0; collect object_10 object_2; collect object_5 object_1; collect object_6 object_1; collect object_7 object_1; collect object_8 object_2; collect object_9 object_2; hand object_11; hand object_12; next object_0 object_8; next object_11 object_6; next object_12 object_10; next object_3 object_7; next object_4 object_10; sneeze object_3; sneeze object_4; spring object_5; spring object_8; stupendous object_1; stupendous object_2; texture object_10; texture object_5; texture object_6; texture object_7; texture object_8; texture object_9.
Scenario A goal: next object_11 object_7 and next object_12 object_8.

Scenario A candidate plan (for validation): clip object_12 object_4 object_10; wretched object_4 object_10 object_8 object_2; tightfisted object_12 object_4 object_8; wretched object_3 object_7 object_6 object_1; clip object_11 object_3 object_6; wretched object_3 object_6 object_7 object_1; tightfisted object_11 object_3 object_7.
Scenario B objects: object_0 to object_13 inclusive are potentially relevant; scenario content may reference the union set specified in init.

Scenario B initial facts: cats object_0; cats object_1; collect object_10 object_3; collect object_11 object_3; collect object_6 object_2; collect object_7 object_2; collect object_8 object_2; collect object_9 object_3; hand object_12; hand object_13; next object_0 object_9; next object_1 object_9; next object_12 object_11; next object_13 object_7; next object_4 object_8; next object_5 object_11; sneeze object_4; sneeze object_5; spring object_6; spring object_9; stupendous object_2; stupendous object_3; texture object_10; texture object_11; texture object_6; texture object_7; texture object_8; texture object_9.
Scenario B goal: next object_12 object_10 and next object_13 object_9.

knowledge_extraction.system_prompt: You analyze action descriptions and produce a normalized symbolic specification without emitting PDDL. Capture predicates and each action's parameters, preconditions, add effects, and delete effects in a concise machine-readable draft.
knowledge_extraction.prompt: Your name is rules_miner. Use the following public information to extract the planning model details: {environment->public_information}. Provide a compact JSON-like draft including: predicates, actions with parameter lists and their preconditions/add_effects/del_effects, and any notes about potential ambiguities. Do not produce PDDL.

state_assembly.system_prompt: You aggregate objects, initial states, and goals into clearly separated scenarios without emitting PDDL. Ensure all symbols referenced in facts appear in the object list.
state_assembly.prompt: Your name is state_analyst. Using the public information: {environment->public_information}, compile a structured draft with: objects (the union set needed), scenario_a {init: [...], goal: [...]}, scenario_b {init: [...], goal: [...]}. Validate obvious inconsistencies and note any that remain. Do not produce PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL for the FastDownward solver. You will integrate drafts from multiple agents and produce a final PDDL domain and problem set. You must: 1) Define a domain with predicates and six STRIPS actions: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted, exactly as specified; 2) Produce two separate PDDL problem instances, one for scenario_a and one for scenario_b, each with its own init and goal; 3) Ensure syntactic compatibility with FastDownward (define, :predicates, :action with :parameters, :precondition and :effect sections; problems with :objects, :init, :goal; untyped objects or use the default type object); 4) Keep effects as add and delete lists (no conditional effects). Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags, and each PDDL problem between its own <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Integrate the following drafts into a coherent planning model. Action and predicate definitions must strictly follow the described semantics. If drafts contain minor ambiguities, resolve them conservatively in favor of the explicit descriptions. Then output: one PDDL domain and two PDDL problems (scenario_a and scenario_b). Draft 1 (rules): {rules_draft}. Draft 2 (state): {state_draft}. Important requirements: Use only the predicates mentioned; actions must match the given preconditions and effects; include every object symbol appearing in the scenarios; goals should conjunctively require all listed goal facts for their scenario. Target FastDownward. Enclose the domain in <domain></domain> and each problem in its own <problem></problem>.
